alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 9:41AM CST until January 26 at 6:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Near Folsom affecting St. Tammany Parish. Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. For the Tchefuncte River...including Folsom, U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tchefuncte River Near Folsom. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Areas of Spring Park and Albert Thompson Road will be inundated. Homes will flood if the river rises higher. Evacuation of those areas is recommended. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.0 feet on 01/29/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
